salute.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to move your right hand to your head, especially in order to show respect to an officer in the army, navy etc
salute.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: The two soldiers saluted Lieutenant Cecil.
The men jumped to their feet and saluted.
salute.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to praise someone for the things they have achieved, especially publicly
salute.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: James Joyce was saluted as the greatest writer of the 20th century.
salute.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to greet someone in a polite way, especially by moving your hand or body
salute.translation[1].definitions[0].def: an act of raising your right hand to your head as a sign of respect, usually done by a soldier to an officer
salute.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: As they left, the corporal gave them a respectful salute.
The officer raised his hand in salute.
salute.translation[1].definitions[1].def: something that expresses praise to someone for something they have achieved, or that expresses honour or respect to someone or something
salute.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: Everyone at the table raised their glasses in salute.
His first words were a salute to the people of South Africa.
salute.translation[1].definitions[2].def: an occasion when guns are fired into the air in order to show respect for someone important
